text:
Originally reported by: **Chris Rebert (BitBucket: [cvrebert](http://bitbucket.org/cvrebert), GitHub: @cvrebert?)**

---

Discussion of https://bitbucket.org/logilab/pylint/issue/32/e1101-false-positives-for-exception suggests that the most straightforward solution to that bug might be an astroid brain plugin to add correct knowledge of the attributes of Python's built-in exceptions (such as `.args`, `.message`, etc.).

---
- Bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issue/81
title: Add brain plugin for attributes of Python exceptions
Add brain plugin for attributes of Python exceptions

text:
> Discussion of https://bitbucket.org/logilab/pylint/issue/32/e1101-false-positives-for-exception

Which is now to say, discussion of [edit: https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/32 ]

Unfortunately, I couldn't do anything with brain transforms, the creation of exception instances is beyond the AST level. But I managed to fix it through a special object model, which did the job quite nicely. Unfortunately, this is going to be released in 2.0, so it's going to take a while before going in the wild.
